title: A Matter of Humanities
description: Marcus Welby hires brash young Doctor Kiley to assist in his bustling general practice. Among Welby's most pressing cases is a young man suffering from aphasia whose wife is seeking to have him committed to an institution.

title: Hello, Goodbye, Hello
description: Miss Ruth Adams is a wonderful teacher, very engaged with and loved by her children. So when she slaps one of them in a fit of rage, her principal sends her to see Dr. Welby for a psychiatric reference. But her problem isn't psychiatric - it is a gliosarcoma, inoperable - a death sentence for a young teacher just beginning her life and career. Dr. Kiley must break the news to her, and then finds himself increasing drawn into the woman's final days.

title: The Foal
description: Welby fights bureaucratic pressure from a young couple and an unfeeling psychologist as he tries to help the couple's 7-year-old autistic, severely withdrawn son learn how to communicate.

title: Don't Ignore the Miracles
description: Claire visits Dr. Welby certain she has begun to enter menopause, only to discover that at 42 she has finally become pregnant. Her husband Paul was about to leave her for Maggie, a younger woman he has been seeing. A baby seems to be the last thing they want, and Clair considers and almost has an abortion. Delivery is likely to be difficult and Dr. Welby even mentions the possibility of a "defective baby". This episode tells the story of how the older couple learns to cope, and hopefully will learn to love, their new child.

title: Silken Threads and Silver Hooks
description: Actress Nadine Cabot suffers a cerebrovascular accident, more commonly know as a stroke, when a small aneurysm in her brain ruptures. Dr. Welby diagnoses her and gets her right to the hospital, but during the cerebral angiography she experiences another bleed, necessitating immediate surgery. Neurosurgeon Dr. Hoving does what he can, but he cannot completely seal off the defect, and Cabot awakens with certain deficits. Her husband and manager pushes her hard during her rehabilitation, but is he pushing her too fast? And why is his so insistent she work so hard? If he doesn't ease up, he might just push her into another stroke.

title: All Flags Flying
description: Captain Rick Ballinger, retired Naval hero, has finally finished building his boat, and now plans to sail it back to the places he visited during his military service, bringing with him his son Sailor. But his shortness of breath, cough, and numbness of the hands suggest that may not be a good idea. Dr. Welby discovers from a blood examination that he suffers from pernicious anemia - a treatable disease if he's willing to follow a doctor's advice. Unfortunately, his pride goads him into making poor decisions that might cost him and his son their lives.

title: Echo of a Baby's Laugh
description: Dr. Welby helps a young, pregnant woman come to terms with her past - namely, a past relationship she had concealed from her husband. Her previous pregnancy was ended by abortion - after she develops complications late in her third trimester. When Welby tells the husband about his wife's past (she was just a teenager when she was pregnant before), the man is furious and wants to leave his wife, but Welby sets him straight.

title: The White Cane
description: A blind couple's relationship is tested when an operation restores the young man's sight and they have to reconcile their worlds.

title: The Vrahnas Demon
description: An aging yet robust diver refuses to take Dr. Welby's advice to slow down after he's informed that he has emphysema.

title: Madonna with Knapsack and Flute
description: Dr. Welby's girlfriend, Myra, takes a pregnant hippie into her home.

title: Homecoming
description: A young man named Scott Behrman, who has recently quit using LSD, bursts into Welby's clinic in a stupor. An after-effect of his withdrawal of the drug (which he started using to deal with family pressures and the death of his mother), Behrman will suffer several more of these "acid flashes," the tipoff to Welby that the young man may need more serious intervention to help completely heal him. However, Welby has to deal with Behrman's stubborn father who believes that, given a job with the family's warehousing business and a little love, the attacks will go away. It takes the father - and Kiley, who disagrees with Welby's handling of the matter - witnessing one of his son's episodes to make him realize that his son needs help.

title: Let Ernest Come Over
description: A policeman who is up for a promotion wishes to keep his illness quiet, but Dr. Welby is unwilling to keep the ailment secret because it may hinder the officer in completing his duties.

title: The Chemistry of Hope
description: Parents of a teenaged boy with leukemia refuse to allow Dr. Welby to inform him of his condition.

title: Neither Punch nor Judy
description: A priest friend of Dr. Welby's suffers severe asthmatic attacks due to pressure from his parishioners. The pressure increases when he is unable to restore an injured man's will to live.

title: Diagnosis: Fear
description: A basketball player seeks out a faith healer for his injured knee instead of having the surgery Dr. Welby recommends.

title: The Soft Phrase of Peace
description: Dr. Welby treats the son of a black leader who is injured by police during a demonstration.

title: Fun and Games and Michael Ambrose
description: A diabetic threatens to stop taking his insulin shots to get even with his father, whom he blames for his mother's suffering.

title: The Legacy
description: Consuelo's mother is diagnosed with a malignant tumor, and although she accepts the doctor's diagnosis, she finds it hard to accept her roommate, a sour woman dealing with a heart condition.

title: Dance to No Music
description: A newly married man asks Dr. Welby to perform a vasectomy. The man believes he has Huntington's Chorea and fears passing the disease down to his children. Welby and Kiley calm the heartbroken wife while attempting to confirm the diagnosis.

title: Go Get 'Em, Tiger
description: While visiting a drug rehab clinic, Dr. Kiley is shocked to see that one of its patients is Mr. Chambers, who used to own an auto repair shop and gave Kiley his first job in order to save money to go to college. Chambers' life fell apart after his daughter was killed in a car accident--he lost his business, became addicted to heroin, turned to crime to support his habit and served a stretch in prison. Kiley is determined to help Chambers get is life back on track, but he runs into unexpected difficulties.

title: Nobody Wants a Fat Jockey
description: Dr. Kiley's old friend Dinty is a jockey endangering his life by abusing diet pills as a desperate measure to maintain an impossibly low weight.

title: The Other Side of the Chart
description: Kiley undergoes a bout with chicken pox, and the young physician deals with an oil field worker who worries over the prospect of having bladder cancer.

title: The "Merely" Syndrome
description: Though she underwent a successful heart surgery as a young girl, a newlywed suffers heart seizures as an adult. Wanting a full life, she pushes the limits despite an overprotective husband.

title: Sea of Security
description: An oceanographer diagnosed with caisson disease (aka "the bends") insists on one last dive, despite Dr. Welby's warnings that just one dive might kill him.

title: The Daredevil Gesture
description: A hemophiliac begs Dr. Welby to keep his condition secret from his new schoolmates. Dr. Welby is concerned that he risks his health to achieve a normal teenage existence.

title: Enid
description: Dr. Kiley rescues a young boy with asthma and meets Enid Cooper, a compassionate counselor at an orphanage whose medicine cabinet suggests a dependence on prescription drugs.

title: Rebel Doctor
description: Dr. Welby steps in to help a former classmate of Dr. Kiley's, a maverick young doctor who is fighting to keep his neighborhood clinic operational.

title: A Very Special Sailfish
description: Cathy Cullen is a pretty high school senior girl comes out of her shell after a successful diet. Shedding her former wallflower self, Cathy quickly becomes popular with boys ... too popular, as she soon contracts a venereal disease. Welby presses for answers as Cathy continually resists treatment and refuses to reveal from where she may have transmitted VD.

title: The Worth of a Man
description: A brilliant trial attorney named Corday - an old Navy friend of Welby's - refuses to interrupt a landmark case for treatment of cancerous lymph nodes. Corday's stubbornness rubs off on his junior partner, who is also suffering from health issues of his own ... and it may cost them much more than a judgment in their favor.

title: Warn the World About Mike
description: Dr. Kiley's brother believes he is dying and refuses to seek help.

title: Epidemic
description: The efforts of Welby and Kiley to battle a flu epidemic are complicated by a rich hypochondriac.

title: To Get Through the Night
description: A psychiatrist discovers he is the victim of a fatal form of sclerosis.

title: Daisy in the Shadows
description: The mother of a mentally handicapped child is forced to realize that she must allow the child to live with foster parents.

title: Labyrinth
description: Scientist Rick Rivera suffers from the physical and psychological after-effects of ingesting hallucinogenic drugs during a trip to Mexico. It is up to Welby to help Rivera cope and force him off the drugs.

title: The Girl from Rainbow Beach
description: Just before her marriage, a young woman discovers she is a victim of a form of leprosy.

title: Aura to a New Tomorrow
description: A young epileptic's effort to hide his affliction endangers his life.

title: Sounding Brass
description: A proud young father refuses to bring his supposedly mentally challenged son to a free clinic for treatment.

title: To Carry the Sun in a Golden Cup
description: Dr. Welby suspects a young nurse is suffering from a hereditary muscular disease.

title: All the Golden Dandelions Are Gone
description: A father with mononucleosis endangers his life by not following Welby's advice.

title: Brave on a Mountain Top
description: Dr. Welby urges a young American Indian with emphysema to return to the clean air of the reservation.

title: Another Buckle for Wesley Hill
description: A man who prided himself on his physical condition and active life must come to terms with the fact that his illness will eventually mean the complete loss of his independence.

title: False Spring
description: Kiley falls for a married woman who has been diagnosed with tuberculosis, after realizing that the woman's husband is emotionally distant with her. Getting the man to come to terms with his wife's condition and realize the seriousness of her condition uncovers some deep-seated secrets of his past.

title: A Passing of Torches
description: A former teacher who is dying and a confused medical student complicate efforts to honor the educator.

title: A Woman's Place
description: Dr. Welby tries to help an alcoholic orthopedic surgeon.

title: A Spanish Saying I Made Up
description: Dr. Welby's nurse Consuelo falls in love with a rich man with old-fashioned principles.

title: Cynthia
description: Despite repeated warnings by Kiley and Welby, a young woman insists on surgery to cure her paralysis. When the doctors stand firm, she sues them for malpractice, hoping to proceed with the surgery. Instead, secrets about her strained relationship with her estranged father rise to the surface.

title: Don't Kid a Kidder
description: Problems occur after Dr. Welby helps a blind woman arrange plastic surgery for her big-eared son.

title: Elegy for a Mad Dog
description: A rabid dog belonging to a mentally challenged teen-aged boy bites Welby.

title: The Contract
description: Dr. Welby becomes involved in a strained marriage when he assists the wife of a musician who becomes ill on a flight to Los Angeles.

title: The Windfall
description: A young girl develops an ulcer because she feels her rich parents don't love her.

title: The House of Alquist
description: Dr. Welby urges a young woman to break with her despotic father and marry the man she loves.

title: In My Father's House
description: After his father suffers a stroke, Steve and the Kiley family are confronted with some arduous decisions with regard to their sire's care.

title: I Can Hardly Tell You Apart
The Best Is Yet to Be
Is It So Soon That I Am Done for - I Wonder What I Was Begun For?
Once There Was a Bantu Prince
Love Is When They Say They Need You
We'll Walk Out of Here Together
He Could Sell Iceboxes to Eskimos
description: Marcus takes on the case of a real estate salesman who has a stroke on an airplane just before it lands in Southern California. Feeling the man needs family support in addition to the care and therapy he's getting in the hospital, Marcus tries to get his estranged wife and daughter to visit him.

title: Please Don't Send Flowers
description: A young housewife and mother of two falls into a deep depression after learning she has uterine cancer.

title: With a Shout, Not a Whimper
Jason Be Nimble, Jason Be Quick
The Problem with Charlie
description: An aspiring student attorney stricken with a stress-related ulcer resists efforts by Welby and Kiley, and his wife, to help him.

title: Catch a Ring That Isn't There
description: Richie Manning, a teen-aged gymnast champion, falls off the rings in gym class, the tip-off that he has a serious drinking problem. Welby and Kiley refer Richie to the Comeback House to help him come to terms with his alcoholism. Compounding matters is the fact that Richie's parents - dry-cleaning store owners who are still grieving the death of their older son - are in denial over the whole thing.

title: The Day After Forever
description: A housewife's involvement with a political campaign quickly turns personal when she catches the eye of the charming young candidate. The woman's contractor husband quickly becomes fraught with worry about his marriage and develops a dependence of tranquilizers.

title: The Panic Path
description: Welby gets dragged into a difficult situation after a friend confides he has lost sexual attraction to his wife. To cover the problem the friend tells his wife he is being treated by Welby, while all the time evidence mounts he is actually having an affair.

title: A Joyful Song
description: A young nun is brought into the hospital and faces a life threatening illness in leukemia. She struggles to come to terms with the situation and her faith, while continuing to try to inspire those around her to be positive.

title: For Services Rendered
description: A coronary bypass may be the only thing that can save the life of dry-cleaning store operator Fred Pulaski. But Pulaski, determined to retire with his wife to a ranch in Southern California, is determined not to have the surgery - he doesn't have health insurance or savings to fund both the surgery and the ranch - and instead keeps his health a secret.

title: Blood Kin
description: An Italian family become concerned when their daughter is diagnosed with a rare blood disorder. The secret to treating the girl is found in her parents blood, but they have a fear of doctors and hospitals in general.

title: The Light at the Threshold
description: A teenage girl suffers from a catastrophic eye condition that could leave her blind. Welby searches for answers while the girl tries to adapt to her situation.

title: A Question of Fault
description: A young boy looses his arm due to poor treatment. The boys father struggles to deal with his perception the boy wont grow up to be a man. To complicate matters the ugly notion of a malpractice is raised.

title: The Circles of Shame
description: Welby is puzzled when a young woman and bride-to-be being treated for an ulcer tries to give herself an abortion, unaware that she is trying to conceal the fact that a co-worker had raped her.

title: Death Is Only a Side Effect
I've Promised You a Father: Part 1
The Brittle Warrior
description: A veteran police sergeant (and new grandfather) tries to hide the debilitating effects of arthritis from his superior officers ... in particular, his son-in-law.

title: Last Flight to Babylon
description: A young pilot who successfully undergoes treatment for bladder cancer becomes suicidal when his medical history prevents his employment and causes his girlfriend to shun him.

title: The Outrage
description: Welby tries to get a high school student, who was raped by his pedophile teacher, to reveal his assailant.

title: Feedback
description: Life outside the ring - permanently - is not easy for Danny Williams, a promising young fighter who shields the fact that he is epileptic from his wife. Williams struggles with having to adjust to a new life, despite the best efforts of Welby, Kiley and Williams' wife, Laurie.

title: Child of Silence
description: Dr. Welby treats a young girl who almost drowned. His biggest challenge is getting through to the girl's mother who adamantly will not let her hearing-impaired daughter be seen by a specialist.

title: The 266 Days
description: A career woman, delighted to be pregnant at last, joins Consuelo's medical care group for pregnant women.

title: Dark Fury: Part 1
description: Kiley's medical and personal lives come into conflict after he takes Susan Davis (a former patient of his) out to dinner. Susan has been harassed by her ex-boyfriend, Wayne, who stalks her undeterred as Kiley repeatedly warns him off. On the night of Kiley's dinner date, Wayne breaks into Susan's apartment and attempts to rape her. Kiley runs in and scares Wayne off, then goes after him. As Kiley is going after Wayne (to get a license and car description so he can contact the police), Wayne loses control of his car and crashes into a concrete barrier, seriously injuring him.

title: Dark Fury: Part 2
description: Kiley finds himself fighting for his medical career after Wayne Trent - the man who was stalking his ex-girlfriend, who was now dating Kiley - files a medical malpractice lawsuit against him, all in the aftermath of a car chase and subsequent accident in which Wayne was seriously injured.

title: Jake's Okay
description: Kiley becomes a mentor-of-sorts to a teen-aged boy named Jake, who - thanks to a disorder caused by undetected minimal brain damage - has poor social skills and does poorly in school.

title: Save the Last Dance for Me
The Fruitfulness of Mrs. Steffie Rhodes
description: Dealing with meager means, a woman expecting quintuplets due to fertility treatments is berated by a disapproving landlord, harassed by the media and besieged by companies wanting to benefit from the woman's circumstances.

title: To Live Another Day
description: A Jewish boy named Simon, who is suffering from a series of illnesses, longs to recover in time for his Bar Mitzvah. But his parents quarrel over whether he should go through with the ceremony, complicating his recovery.

title: The Tidal Wave
description: The Kileys' seemingly amicable plumber suffers from a series of uncontrolled violent outbursts, and it's up to Kiley and Welby to find out why and prescribe treatment ... before the man kills someone.

title: The Strange Behavior of Paul Kelland
The One Face in the World
How Do You Know What Hurts Me?
Prisoner of the Island Cell: Part 1
Prisoner of the Island Cell: Part 2
